availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel J. Moore (Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Julia Ann Hale Moore in Wilson County, Tennessee, on May 27, 1845. Father of Elizabeth S. Moore, Ann E. Moore, James Moore, Levenia F. Moore, Gross H. Moore, Gardiner P. Moore, Teddie Moore, and Jonas P. Moore. Farmer in Gibson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Gibson County, District 7, p. 282B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 520.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 397B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Wilson County, 1828 - 1884: Marriages, p. 170.
"Samuel Jacob Moore (1825-1914)," Find A Grave, Memorial 67393525, accessed January 20, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67393525.
